description: Learn the basics of Java programming, including terminology, history, JDK, JVM, and JRE.
Define the structure of a Java class, create executable applications, and run Java programs from the command line.
Declare and initialize variables, understand different data types in Java, including wrapper classes.
Understand the four pillars of OOP: Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, and Abstraction.
Use Java operators, understand their precedence, and apply decision constructs like if/else and switch statements.
Work with one-dimensional and multi-dimensional arrays, ArrayList, and other collection types in Java.
Understand and apply looping constructs like while, do-while, for loops, and advanced flow control.
Understand checked and unchecked exceptions, use try/catch/finally blocks, and create custom exceptions.
Design methods, apply access modifiers, use static methods and fields, and understand method overloading and encapsulation.
Create and manipulate Strings, understand StringBuilder, and learn about string immutability.
Work with the new Date and Time API introduced in Java 8, including LocalDate, LocalTime, and DateTimeFormatter.
Learn about functional interfaces, write lambda expressions, and understand their use cases.
Understand the use of interfaces and abstract classes, and learn about modifiers and inheritance in interfaces.
Understand static variables/methods, initialization blocks, and scope of variables in Java.
Learn about garbage collection in Java, including how it works and how to write code that facilitates efficient garbage collection.
Learn about organizing Java classes into packages, setting the classpath, and creating JAR files.
